text:
random thought for today - the expression “have all but” drives me a little crazy.

Here’s what I mean “traffic jams have all but vanished”. The writer usually means “traffic jams have virtually/practically vanished”.

But I read it “traffic jams have done everything except vanish” IE “super traffic jams all over or something.”

That is all.
as Spock would say: that is illogical
I imagine this is why the English language is hard to learn. Because we just kinda wing it with the meanings.
